description: Egypt's government is in turmoil, putting its economy at even further risk. Obamacare implementation is delayed, and employers may take advantage by exploring how to drop health care coverage. And why Freakonomics thinks McDonald's is a global economic indicator of hope.
byline: Mark Garrison, Stacey Vanek Smith, D Gorenstein, Rob Schmitz, Stephen Dubner, Megan Verlee, Kai Ryssdal and Andy Roberts
teaser: Egypt's government is in turmoil, putting its economy at even further risk. Obamacare implementation is delayed, and employers may take advantage by exploring how to drop health care coverage. And why Freakonomics thinks McDonald's is a global economic indicator of hope.
title: Marketplace for Wednesday, July 3, 2013
